content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. However, if they picked B initially, I will switch my strategy to pick B on the second round as well and then stick with that choice on the third round (picking R would result in a loss of 15$). This way, I can ensure that I earn at least 60$ over the three rounds.

With this reasoning in mind, my first choice would be R (R as the last character). After observing their response, I will adjust my subsequent choices accordingly to maximize my earnings over the game.
